content: Derrida links structuralist obsession w/ an anxiety (inquiétude) about (sur) language, an anxiety of (du) language and in (dans) language itself
linkedContent: Derrida links structuralist obsession w/ an anxiety (inquiétude) about (sur) language, an anxiety of (du) language and in (dans) language itself

content: structuralist attitude, et notre posture aujourd’hui devant ou dans le langage, not only moments in history: étonnement, plutôt, par le langage comme origine de l’histoire > par l'historicité elle-même
linkedContent: structuralist attitude, et notre posture aujourd’hui devant ou dans le langage, not only moments in history: étonnement, plutôt, par le langage comme origine de l’histoire > par l'historicité elle-même

content: yet, to dream of reducing this link to a sign of the times is to dream of violence: the sign is more or less, something other than a sign of an epoch
linkedContent: yet, to dream of reducing this link to a sign of the times is to dream of violence: the sign is more or less, something other than a sign of an epoch

content: form fascinates when one no longer has force to understand force w/in itself [decadence?]
linkedContent: form fascinates when one no longer has force to understand force w/in itself [decadence?]

content: structuralism & literary criticism (structuralist in essence/destiny), lapse of attention paid to force (the tension of force itself) > even take revenge on force by declaring separation the condition of the work
linkedContent: structuralism & literary criticism (structuralist in essence/destiny), lapse of attention paid to force (the tension of force itself) > even take revenge on force by declaring separation the condition of the work

content: structuralism will never be able to contribute to a “future history of imagination and affectivity” [Jean-Pierre Richard’s hope]
linkedContent: structuralism will never be able to contribute to a “future history of imagination and affectivity” [Jean-Pierre Richard’s hope]

content: the possibility of speech & of being always already w/in it [historicity?], la répétition enfin avouée, extended to the dimensions of world culture—[of] a surprise incomparable to any other, a surprise responsible for Western thought
linkedContent: the possibility of speech & of being always already w/in it [historicity?], la répétition enfin avouée, extended to the dimensions of world culture—[of] a surprise incomparable to any other, a surprise responsible for Western thought

content: structure is the formal unity of form & meaning
linkedContent: structure is the formal unity of form & meaning

content: [metaphor of structuralism]: a city no longer inhabited, reduced to its skeleton, haunted by meaning & culture > cette hantise is the mode (absent/present) of thing itself in pure language (housed in pure literature)
linkedContent: [metaphor of structuralism]: a city no longer inhabited, reduced to its skeleton, haunted by meaning & culture > cette hantise is the mode (absent/present) of thing itself in pure language (housed in pure literature)

linkedContent: w/in structure there’s not only form, relation & configuration > there’s an interdependency & totality that is always concrete

content: structural consciousness a catastrophic one, simultaneously destroyed & destructive (destructuring) > decadence, period proper to all movement of consciousness [Nietzsche]
linkedContent: structural consciousness a catastrophic one, simultaneously destroyed & destructive (destructuring) > decadence, period proper to all movement of consciousness [Nietzsche]

linkedContent: in structuralism, content (living energy of meaning) is neutralized by form > they’ll say this is the author’s responsibility before the critic’s

linkedContent: like melancholy for Gide, structural criticism only possible after defeat of force: a reflection of the constituted, constructed: historical, eschatological, crepuscular

content: solicit (sollus: whole; citare: put in motion)
linkedContent: solicit (sollus: whole; citare: put in motion)

content: to see structure more clearly, solicit it, threaten its supports: concentrate on its [structuralism’s] keystone (la clef de voûte) (possibility & fragility of its existence) > the secret place where structure is neither construction nor ruin but lability

linkedContent: for Kant, [productive] imagination was already art itself > originally, did not distinguish btwn beauty & truth

content: consciousness takes on meaning by way of consciousness of nothing, thus is speech brought forth > car la pensée de la chose comme ce qu'elle est se confond déjà avec l'expérience de la pure parole; et celle-ci avec l'expérience elle-même
linkedContent: consciousness takes on meaning by way of consciousness of nothing, thus is speech brought forth > car la pensée de la chose comme ce qu'elle est se confond déjà avec l'expérience de la pure parole; et celle-ci avec l'expérience elle-même

content: doesn’t pure speech require inscription, isn’t it a privileged representation of inscription? just like Leibniz’s essence requires existence (pushes out toward world), power <small>></small> act?

content: pure book must be about nothing (Flaubert, Artaud)
linkedContent: pure book must be about nothing (Flaubert, Artaud)

content: God of Leibniz does not know the anguish of choice, only one book distributed through all books, God’s Will always chooses the “best”

content: writing, not a determined pathos, an empirical state of writer, but responsibility of angustia: [Derrida is privileging a power of equivocality over creativity of classical God, anguish connoting a narrowing, a loss of breath, a restriction, constraint, and thus the anguish of choice]

content: “pure book turns toward Eastern edge of this absence [Blanchot’s pure absence]…is its first and proper content”
linkedContent: “pure book turns toward Eastern edge of this absence [Blanchot’s pure absence]…is its first and proper content”

content: for Blanchot, pure absence, the excess of everything—possibility of writing (absence of everything in which presence is announced) > makes one work
linkedContent: for Blanchot, pure absence, the excess of everything—possibility of writing (absence of everything in which presence is announced) > makes one work

content: absence & haunting of divine sign (Jewish God) [cf. GOD], anguish of Hebraic ruah (pneuma), regulates modern books/criticism/aesthetics
linkedContent: absence & haunting of divine sign (Jewish God) [cf. GOD], anguish of Hebraic ruah (pneuma), regulates modern books/criticism/aesthetics

content: for Leibniz, no tragedy of the book, only one Book, this same Book is distributed throughout all books [cf. Theodicy pp. 375-78]

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

linkedContent: for Leibniz, no tragedy of the book, only one Book, this same Book is distributed throughout all books [cf. Theodicy pp. 375-78]

content: to write: 1) not only to conceive Leibnizian book as an impossible possibility (as Mallarmé names the limit) 2) ce n'est pas seulement savoir que le Livre n'existe pas et qu'à jamais il y a des livres où (se) brise, avant même d'avoir été un, le sens d'un monde impensé par un sujet absolu [the English translation of this sentence fails to capture the sense of the books themselves shattering] 3) nor is it to have lost the certainty of pages binding themselves into a “book of reason” 4) not only to know that the non-written can’t be relegated to having no basis by the obliging negativity of some dialectic 5) not only to know that through writing the best may not transpire 6) it is the impossibility of making meaning precede writing: it is to lower meaning while elevating inscription

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: writing does not await prescription from some topos ouranios, or divine understanding it’s because writing is inaugural that it is dangerous and anguishing, doesn’t know where it’s going, essential precipitation toward meaning that it constitutes—is its future [ex-stasis?]
linkedContent: writing does not await prescription from some topos ouranios, or divine understanding it’s because writing is inaugural that it is dangerous and anguishing, doesn’t know where it’s going, essential precipitation toward meaning that it constitutes—is its future [ex-stasis?]

content: God imprints secondarity on every navigation of the human: 1) passage of deferred reciprocity btwn reading & writing? 2) absolute witness who’s already read what you will write: third party as transparency of meaning? [circular logos]
linkedContent: God imprints secondarity on every navigation of the human: 1) passage of deferred reciprocity btwn reading & writing? 2) absolute witness who’s already read what you will write: third party as transparency of meaning? [circular logos]

content: writing is inaugural > dangerous, anguishing
linkedContent: writing is inaugural > dangerous, anguishing

content: writing is only capricious through cowardice
linkedContent: writing is only capricious through cowardice

linkedContent: John Chrysostom: writing is second best course

linkedContent: the project of infinite tradition must be acknowledged as such: that it can always fail is the mark of its pure finitude/pure historicity

content: Derrida explains that by opposing force to structure he’s not envisioning an economy of pure, shapeless force > he opposes one series to the other to make apparent the noncritical privilege granted to one of the terms (structure, site, spatiality): a strategy which uses strength of field to turn its own stratagems against it > dislocate, fissure the system: le dé-limitant de part en part [delimit as describe, mark, and delimit as un-limit]
linkedContent: Derrida explains that by opposing force to structure he’s not envisioning an economy of pure, shapeless force > he opposes one series to the other to make apparent the noncritical privilege granted to one of the terms (structure, site, spatiality): a strategy which uses strength of field to turn its own stratagems against it > dislocate, fissure the system: le dé-limitant de part en part [delimit as describe, mark, and delimit as un-limit]
